Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in central Rome”
Reviews.Author: monkey1956
Reviews.Content: Not cheap but very functional, clean, nice (modern) furniture, free wifi, excellent breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Shame about the room(box)”
Reviews.Author: Giggsy4174
Reviews.Content: The positives first, Great location! The negatives next, the room is just to small if you travelling as a couple, you are constantly bumping into each other to get around the room to the so called bathroom,which you have no privacy as its a sliding smoked glass door/unit that is contained within the small bedroom. It is certainly not a place to unwind after a long day sightseeing,no tea or coffee making facilities!! The TV channel is very limited,all the instructions were in Italian. we looked at ordering a pay for view film, when we enquired to see if we had the option to view them in English we were told by reception that they didn't know and that if we selected a film incorrectly we would still be charged the 9 euro rate!!! The air conditioning in the room didnt work so even in february and march the heat was uncomfortable!! The sauna had to be booked in advance so if after a long day you fancied chilling out,you may be disappointed if somebody else has beaten you to it!! Breakfast was basic and adequate!! On the whole if your an independent traveller in town for one night it's ok,but if like us your there for four nights seriously think again!! I didn't think we had value for money and would not rate the hotel as 4 star!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: JJFuninthesun
Reviews.Content: I just stayed in the Venetia Palace and it was very good. The room was quiet and clean. Bed was very comfortable and I couldn’t hear any noise from outside the room so their claim of “sound proof rooms” is truthful. I had a limited time in Rome and I needed to stay somewhere close to the train station and metro. This fit the bill nicely. I was able to see many of the sites and return here with ease. I stayed in room 503 and it had a small terrace balcony that was a very nice touch. The bathroom is very small but adequate and they provide toiletries but the shampoo and conditioner are combined (fine for me but my wife would not have liked). The shower was powerful and very good. The full breakfast is good and is a combination of hot and cold items and they will make cappuccino and espresso to order. Train station, Metro, and good restaurants are all within walking distance. I recommend staying here of you need a convenient place to base camp in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Exploring”
Reviews.Author: ThePhotographer1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in 2009 its in a fantastic location next to the Termini rail station and the bus stop where the Ryanair shuttle bus drops you off... we booked rail tickets for Pompei and it was so easy to get around from termini. I agree the rooms are small but hey if you are there for the sightseeing you will never been in the room. It is modern and clean and the breakfast was adequate and for us a good price. Would i stay there again ... yes most probably.

Reviews.Title: “Easy access to transport - great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Jenny L
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at Venetia Palace in between a tour through Tuscany and up to Venice and a flight to Split. With its easy access to the train station the Venetia Palace provided us with all the comforts of home, required after a busy week. Our room for four people was comfortable and elegantly decorated with contemporary minimalism; very stylish and clean with two balcony/terraces. Up one flight of stairs was a hot tub. Breakfast was delicious with a variety of hot and cold dishes. The staff were very helpful. Would definitely recommend Ven Palace to anyone who is needs easy access to public transport.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a hotel only to sleep in”
Reviews.Author: Szymon W
Reviews.Content: The only thing good about this hotel is its proximity to the train station - which may be considered a disadvantage too. It is not good value for the money. The rooms are tiny - almost claustrophobic.The toilet is probably the worst design i have seen in a while -the toilet seat being located just next to a glass wall that (in the case of my room didnt even fully closed - which means no privacy whatsoever if 2 people in the room). The breakfast will get you through the day but don't expect miraculous culinary experiences. I really dont't understand all the good reviews this place has gotten... It is ok-ish: just to come late at night - sleep through the night and leave early in the morning - not a place to relax after an adventurous day in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Rome - and doesn't cost the earth”
Reviews.Author: Matthew_benson83
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night - definitely recommend it. Paid €120 for a night which is cheap for Rome for this quality. Really clean, five minutes to Termini train station, lots of places to eat near hotel. Only slight negative was the pillow was a little lumpy and not all that comfortable, but it wasn't a major issue obviously.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond expectations on a great location”
Reviews.Author: KatarinaO1
Reviews.Content: Close to trains, buses and some of Romes many attractions this hotel can be highly recommended. Contemporary design and clean rooms, jacuzzi in the bathroom and a breakfast with egg&bacon, youghurt and fresh fruit. (of course along with the cakes, croissants and cappuccino!)

Reviews.Title: “Good location, ideal for short stay”
Reviews.Author: Alpacatogo
Reviews.Content: Although arrived early in day let us have room. Given room 511 with balcony couldnt swing a mouse let alone a cat, bathroom so small as well. Had asked for quiet room but chiller outside kept us awake, probably our problem due to living in a quiet place normally. Went to reception next day asked to be moved - no problems just gave us a different room which was better in size. Staff helpful, breakfast okay, rooms clean and tidy. Fine for short stay, as everyone else says great location for bus, metro and trains. As always a 4* in Italy isn't always like a 4* star in some other countries, but the room rate reflects that being in the centre of Rome. We used it after a cruise and found it very convenient. Would stop again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base in Rome”
Reviews.Author: feebee33
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay here and had a fabulous stay. The staff were friendly, apart from one waitress who was quite rude but it was very busy at breakfast time and the customers were quite demanding. The hot tub on the hotel roof made it for us - nothing better after a day walking around the sights to relax. The location is fantastic - very near to Termini station, so easy to get a train to and from Fiumincino, but far enough away from the centre to provide plenty of cheaper options for dining and drinking. There are lots of backstreet trattoria's which offer fantastic food for very good prices. The hotel was very clean and modern, and our room was very comfortable with a large powerful shower (always disappointed with hotel showers but not this one). We never made it to the sauna/Turkish bath unfortunately, we were always in the hot tub :) The only disappointment was that the hot tub wasn't working on the Sunday and they couldn't get anyone out to fix it until Monday, and we'd had a particularly busy day and were looking forward to a couple of hours in there to relax. The breakfast was adequate but don't expect the same as you would get in the UK in terms of the hot food - the sausages and bacon are not the same. There was a good selection of breads, fruit, pastries, cereals, yoghurts and cold meats and cheeses, and the scrambled eggs were fantastic. You won't go hungry. We would definitely go back to this hotel if we ever go to Rome again. We chose it as a base to explore and didn't expect to spend much time there, but we found ourselves wanting to get back for a respite from the hustle and bustle of the city.

Reviews.Title: “An adequate place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: Gourmand_nl
Reviews.Content: I needed a hotel for a congress I went to in Rome. This one was not to expensive and at walking distance of the congress venue. It is a 3 minute walk from the Termini station (where all airport trains and shuttle arrive) so it is a very good location from that point of view. Reception at the check-in desk was friendly but not more than that. The room I had was small but acceptable for 1 person. I did not like the airco much. No possibility to cool the room while you're away and put it off when you arrive. Without airco it did get hot in the room. Bathroom had a shower and bidet and was acceptably clean. A minibar is present, TV with a small number of chanels and free Wi-Fi internet with acceptable speed throughout the hotel. Breakfast is nice but not special. Staff at the breakfast is very friendly and helpfull. The hotel has a good jaccuzi on the rooftop, a small fitness room and a sauna/turkish bath (no extra charge for any of these). The hotel bar is small. It is difficult to order anything because most of the time there was no one there. All in all an acceptable hotel if you just need a place to sleep and have breakfast. But don't expectmuch more of it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean and Modern Hotel in Decent Location”
Reviews.Author: Martin H
Reviews.Content: The rooms here are very modern and have a minimalist feel but are well equipped and comfortable in a good location near to the Termini. Free WiFi was a bonus, breakfast not too exciting but adequate. The bar was closed for my entire stay, no barman claimed the receptionist. Overall a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel very close to termini and very clean!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tourista16
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ventia Palace Hotel for 2 nights. We checked in very late in the evening ( around 1:30am) and they were very accomodating and had our room keys ready. Room is a little small to American standards but the furniture is well arranged and there was no issue with space. The room is modern and you have to leave your room key in the slot next to the door to keep the lights and electricity on in the room. Otherwise it will shut off after a few minutes. The bathroom was very clean and cleaned daily but a little dark. The room was very clean and the bed was comfy. The hotel also gave you complimentary house slippers. Hot tub in the top floor was always open. Breakfast is the morning was excellent. I've never had such a good breakfast in Europe!! Breakfast staff was very friendly and spoke English. She even gave us the name of some places to go shopping in the area. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. They arranged for our tickets to the hop on hop off tour which was very helpful. They also gave us a map of room which came in very useful. All in all the hotel was a fabulous pick and we would definately stay at Venetia Palace hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Updated, modern hotel close to Termini”
Reviews.Author: Spiritgrl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 1 night before our cruise. Conveniently located within quick walking distance to Termini, we wanted easy access to get to the port of Civitavecchia. I chose this hotel due to location and 4 star rating, with free wi-fi and breakfast included. Normal rates seemed a bit pricey to me given its location, but I got a really good promotional rate otherwise I'm not sure I would have considered it. The hotel is very modern and feels fairly new. Rooms are a decent size. It's also situated on a street with little traffic so we found our room very quiet and peaceful which was need to overcome our jetlag. Arriving several hours before normal check-in, we were still able to get a room which was great after a long day of traveling. Walking to the Colosseum and Forum is possible but is probably about 15-20 minutes. After a day of seeing those sites in the hot sun, we ended up hopping on the metro (1 euro each) back to Termini since we were quite exhausted.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and quiet hotel, in great location, 2min from Termini!”
Reviews.Author: V M
Reviews.Content: Venetia Palace Hotel is a modern, calm and quiet HOTEL in Rome, 2min by foot to Terminy station (train and metro). +quiet room +no noise or light disturbing your sleep +jacuzzi on the roof of the hotel +modern fitness + sauna +great location -poor breakfest -bar always closed

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Melissa C
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Venetia Palace this past weekend for two nights with my boyfriend and it was brilliant. Our room was ready even though we arrived early which was a delight. We stayed in a standard room which was a decent size, clean, modern, and had a very comfortable bed. There were only two drawbacks about the room: 1) that all of the lights, air conditioning, and water are run by the one key card they give you. So the key must always stay in the room if one person wants to go out; 2) that the toilet is about 2 feet from the bed. That's just too close for my comfort. The staff were excellent, friendly and helpful throughout our stay. The breakfast was amazing with so many choices. Breads, cereals, meats, cheeses, fruit, coffee, juice, etc. So much selection and it was all fresh. The jacuzzi tub on the top terrace was lovely after a long day of walking or for a mid-day break. It closes at 9pm though so don't expect a late night dip. The location of the hotel was also so convenient. It was only a couple minutes walk from Termini station which was great for getting to/from the airport and the major sights. The Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, and Colosseum are an easy walk and you really get to see the city that way. Alternatively, you can get to the Colosseum by metro in less than 10mins and the Vatican in about 20. Overall the hotel was absolutely lovely and I would certainly stay there again if I go back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for staying in Rome”
Reviews.Author: foxy071
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent hotel a short walk from Termini station which allowed us to drop our luggage and start exploring straight away. Room ready and accessible early after an email request due to early flight. Hotel and room very clean, very friendly staff and service, good value for money and we would recommend this to you if you stay in Rome which is just beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could stay longer”
Reviews.Author: SamSydneyAustralia
Reviews.Content: Very modern, great location, particularly if you are arriving via airport train after a long days travel. Easy 5 minute walk from termini, therefore can visit all major tourist spots walking and catching metro back or vice versa. Breakfast was included and sufficient, free wi-fi, very funky sunken bath with spa jets in room. What looked like brand new state of the art gym, should have used it...to busy eating pasta though. Staff were very helpful and friendly, room was super clean with air-con. The roof top spa was perfect after a long days pounding the pavement, there was one day when the water was freezing & we couldn't get in..perhaps it had just been cleaned. I would have loved to stay longer than 5 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing....”
Reviews.Author: Kylie2011
Reviews.Content: After 3 weeks of constant travel with my sister and elderly mother, we wanted to finish our trip in a lovely 4 star hotel, unfortunately whilst this hotel has a 4 star rating it's a 3 1/2 star at best (and I'm being generous). When we booked the accommodation we were advised that we would have 3 single beds, it turned out to be 2 single beds and the worst fold out couch we slept on during our entire 3 week holiday. When we spoke to reception there was nothing they could do... Disappointing. Once we unpacked we noticed a foul odour coming from the bathroom drains. Housekeepings solution was to pour some drain cleaner down the sink, whilst the smell did improve it by no means disappeared. On night 1 my sister and I decided to go out for dinner whilst our mother rested. The remote control to the TV did not work as per the instructions, so I went to reception to ask for assistance and was advised that they would send someone up, unfortunately that someone never arrived. On day 2 we left the hotel at 9 am to tour Rome, at 3:30 when we returned to the hotel, room service had only just begun to clean our room and as a result they asked us to come back. Surely they could have done this earlier. I also agree with other reviewers the showers are a poor design and extremely awkward. On a good note the Internet connection was great as was the location. Whilst our complaints fell on deaf ears the staff were very polite. I know this sounds like whiney email, but this was a really disappointing way to end our trip, especially when we had stayed at 3 star hotels that were far better than this hotel (and cheaper) In summary, would not stay here again and would not recommend it unless you were able to secure it at a better price.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: DahliaBlack
Reviews.Content: Friendly service, clean and comfortable. Near termini, makes getting around easy. Free internet, when asked provided gluten free - no extra charge. Jakuzi, clean. Breakfast room a little small, needs some more thought. Overall a good experience, would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing experience!”
Reviews.Author: Zu3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights. We had booked a much cheaper hotel at first, but my boyfriend changed it to this hotel, much to my displeasure, since this was quite more expensive then what I was willing to give. BUT I ended up being so thankfull in the end. The hotel has a friendly staff, it's very clean, and the sauna and jacuzzi is the best part! Rome is very hectic, and you walk a lot, so after a looong day of sightseeing and shopping, the jacuzzi on the rooftop does wonders for your aching limbs! The room is a bit small, but well equipped with tv, table, minibar, closet with safe etc. Breakfast was really good and enjoyable, something for every taste. All in all a great place to stay for a romantic getaway to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: Oceantreader
Reviews.Content: Poor service, free Internet because you wouldn't pay for this speed, rude staff, smelly poorly appointed gym, no parking. On a positive note, breakfast was good though the coffee was awful.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location Location !!!!”
Reviews.Author: manthy
Reviews.Content: After two days searching for a central hotel I found this little gem. Although it is the middle price range I got a good deal with Laterooms. The hotel is a 2 mins walk from Roma Termini Station but in a quiet street. The rooms are bright and clean with all amenties needed. The staff where pleasant and helpful and even though my flight was 5 hours after checkout I was allowed to leave suitcase and go and stay in the fantastic rooftop terrace with jazucci!! The location is fantastic for walking everywhere in Rome and travelling by train/or Metro if required. The only criticism would be the bathroom walls where made of frosted glass in my room therefore you can see people in the shower/toilet. If I had one recommendation to make to anybody who goes to Rome, take the open top bus tour to get your bearing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice double beds in all rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Kevin_WalnutCreek
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the hotel during a number of business trips to Rome. The Hotel is 3 blocks from the Termini Train Station (Stazione Termini). This is not the best neighborhood in Rome, but it is very convenient to the train station and I feel safe with all the tourists around. I have seen 3 or 4 room styles. They are all very similar and upgraded pretty recently. All the rooms have 2 twins that can be made up as a double bed. The beds are firm and very comfortable. The wall mounted flat screen TV is nice even if the rooms are small. The rooms have a mini bar, safe and good free wireless internet. You need to get a new free wireless code from the TV every 3 hours. The room furniture is minimal with only a built-in counter near the bed. The showers are a bit larger than most in Rome. The shower head hangs from the ceiling and takes a bit getting use to. The AC and heating was good. The rooms a generally larger than many I have stayed at in Rome. This hotel has a small exercise room and sauna in the basement and a hot tub on the roof. The free breakfast is in the restaurant in a lower level and has a good selection of hot eggs, pastries, fresh fruit and fresh squeezed orange juice. The staff is very friendly and the front desk staff speaks very good English. I will continue to stay here as long as the prices are reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled by the 4 star rating.”
Reviews.Author: Ym32
Reviews.Content: Located close to the Roma Termini station, this hotel certainly is situated in a good location just three blocks away from the station but is still a long trek from the leonard express terminal which is a 400m walk from the main entrance. So it took 20 mins to get there from terminals 26 -28. Room Room was very small with poor quality fittings. Wardrobe too close to the bed and I broke my toe nail opening it. Also the side of the wardrobe was hanging off - not what you expect in a 4 star hotel. See image. There was also a very clinical backlight above the bed which felt more like an asylum light than the warm light you would expect in a 4 star hotel room. Wi-Fi Thankfully the wif-fi service was free but nothing to write home about. The service is delivered via a code on the TV that is renewed every 4 hours so if you are a frequent user or dependent on wi-fi you will not appreciate having to renew your code every 4 hours. The download speed was around 5 MB/s with the upload speed no more than 1 mb/s at best. YouTube struggled to load but text-based websites were fine. The wi-fi was also monitored by the hotel. Breakfast Breakfast was perfunctory - self-service coffee machine. The maids did not greet us once but did offer to make a coffee as I was making my own which seemed a bit pointless. You get a range of typical breakfast meals - muesli, yoghurt, toast, sausages, croissants etc. The room resembles a cafeteria and didn't exude class or the feeling you were in a supposedly luxury hotel. On the Friday to Sunday the place was very busy and many could not even sit down. Reception Staff. Service was mixed. Some staff were friendly but others aloof and snobbish. One receptionist questioned my entrance into the hotel on my fourth day there even though I had spoken to her earlier. Because I was carrying cans of Fanta she assumed I didn't belong there. Cleaning Room was often not cleaned until the afternoons which was inconvenient. On two ocassions the room was cleaned late even though the sign was on the door requesting the service. Once the maid was opposite and saw us leave at 10am but when we came back at 1pm the room had not been cleaned. Taps in the bathroom were left uncleaned. Other services You had to book the sauna in advance for 45 minute solo sessions but no lockers or robes were provided so it meant sauna users had to walk thorough the reception in wet towels. Very undignified. The gym was small but I could not see any free weights there. No bottled water was provided there either which is an oversight. Conclusion I would not recommend this hotel because of its misleading status and the poor, unfriendly staff, some of whom were snobby in the extreme.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing!!”
Reviews.Author: n1kk1_km
Reviews.Content: I went here with low expectations as friends had warned me generally about all hotels. I was a bit put off when we arrived to check in as the guy was on the phone and was checking us in at the same time - bit rude. I had chosen the deluxe room with the jacuzzi which would be ideal after 6-7 hours of walking and sightseeing - would definately recommend doing this. But i was disappointed with the room as it was very small even though the jacuzzi was a step down tub which was really cosy. The guy changed us to the junior suite at no extra cost the very next day which was great. Would have liked and expected tea/coffee facilities in the room for a 4 star. Bar was never open. Breakfast was very disappointing and cramped- cappacino was good. Ideal place for location as all main attractions are walking distance, we only got the metro to the way to vatican city (walked on the way back). it cost 1 euro each and the station was visible from the hotel - good walking distance. Do not eat in the touristy areas and food is appalling - not authentic and very expensive. Go to the back streets of cavour street (where the roads continues but has a right turn (not far from termini station), and go across the water to traverese area - for £10 got a three course authentic meal with quarter wine!!! do not but mineral water and there are foundations all over which have spring water running through them and is for drinking. For shopping the designer shops are on condetti rd (come off spanish steps and turn right or straight. the high street type of shops are on corso del - all close together where we had the best cappacino in a cafe. All in all, glad we stayed at this hotel - its newly refurbished with a very modern and relaxing touch which is just what you want on a city break.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean hotel with friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: M_Winwood
Reviews.Content: Having booked this hotel at short notice and read some of the reviews, we were not sure what to expect. However we were greeted with friendly, efficient, English speaking staff. Our room was certainly much better than we had ever imagined - all very neat and clean with a modern design. We requested a "quiet, high room" as we do like to be able to sleep in peace at night. We were given a room at the end of a corridor on the third floor above a very quiet side street and the blinds at the windows completely blocked out the light. We were happy with this. The only problem was that there was virtually no sound-proofing between the rooms so when the people next door arrived in the early hours we were disturbed in a big way. This was our only minor gripe but not really the fault of the hotel. The breakfast was good and the staff happy to make us coffee to our liking. Although we did not use it, the hotel had a sauna and spa which looked inviting. The location, only a stones throw from the main Termini station was perfect and it was still easy to access the rest of Rome without feeling as if we were way out of town but whilst staying in a quiet area. We found some very nice places to eat only a short walk away. On our day of leaving, the hotel were only too happy to look after our luggage until it was time for us to catch our train. All in all, a lovely hotel to which we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth a second visit”
Reviews.Author: flyingroo
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with previous reviews of this hotel. It looks great from the outside but there is no substantace to how it delivers service to its customers. The rooms are modern and small but the bed was comfortable. The bathrooms were not very well designed and the finish of the fittings were of low quality. Free wi-fi is available in room. Check in was swift and housekeeping were very good and all areas of the hotel were kept clean. The fitness room was very basic with no free weights available. The hotels one big downfall was its breakfast area. Small and inadequate to accomodate all hotel guests. This lead to guests having to wait for a free table and there was no order in who was served first. The manager of the breakfast area left much to be desired, his manner to guests was very abrubt. The food quality though was in line to other hotels with both hot and continental selections available. There are many hotels around Roma Termini and no doubt one could find one that would provide a more pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay in this hotel again!”
Reviews.Author: Thommytraveler
Reviews.Content: The Venetia Palace hotel in Rome is just like the Colosseum, looks great at first but on closer inspection needs some work. At first glance it looks great, modern, clean and just a walk away from the Termini Station. The women at the front desk are very helpful but that is as good as it gets. We were shown to our room and it was very small, but not only that the bathroom was far from adequate. Everything felt like it was about to fall apart. The toilet jutted out from the wall with no base so when you sat on it it felt as though it was going to break, a larger person may have severe difficulties. When you took a shower it took about 15 minutes for the water to drain, so you are showering in dirty water, the bathroom sink looked as though it was about to fall apart. We were then told of a spa upstairs on the roof and a steam room and sauna. This was wonderful news as we had travelled quite far and needed to relax, I got into the spa and I have no idea what sort of water they used there but my skin tightened and and felt very uncomfortable, after this I walked down to the sauna only to have one of the male staff members hanging around and peering in through the window. This all seemed nothing to the welcoming response you get when you go down for breakfast in the morning. The older gentleman that runs the breakfast area is rude and disgusting to say the least. On our first morning we watched him crash plates, slam doors and talk very rudely to customers, on the second morning it was our turn. He yelled at us that the table we were trying to sit at was for 4 and not 2 , as there were no more tables we moved to another table only to be yelled at again, mind you this was in front of a lot of other guests, very embarrassing and not a great way to start your day. Romans are not the friendliest of people anyway but to get this sort of service in your hotel is far just wrong. DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!1

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: jaamo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located only a few blocks from the main train station in Rome so access to public transit was a breeze. The staff was friendly, helpful and enthusiastic. The rooms were clean, well thought out and not lacking in anything. The decor is very modern, which is not our style, but we'd stay here again and recommend it to anyone. After we checked in and unpacked, as we left to go outside for the fist time, the staff asked us if the room was ok, did we need anything. THey truly seemed interested in making our stay enjoyable. When we asked for a dinner recommendation, the staff quickly offered an excellent,close by restaurant and made the reservation. When we needed the best way to the airport, the same, quick answer and reservation made.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant hotel.”
Reviews.Author: attertone
Reviews.Content: We booked a long weekend to Rome and found almost every thing to be just right. The hotel wasn't as expensive as you'd think it to be for a major city stay. We paid approx. £300 for the 4 nights which isn't much more than you'd expect to pay for a local hotel in the U.K. The rooms were maybe a tad on the small size but still room enough for 2 adults. We were on the 6th floor which we would highly recommend as there was a large balcony which we were able to sit out on to enjoy a few pre-evening drinks in the sun. Rooms have the usual, safe, air con, en-suite bathroom, wi-fi and sat t.v. The bar didn't appear to be open but to be honest there is so much to do in Rome you wouldn't really have a drink at the bar when there is so much to see. This hotel is right by the Termini metro which me and the girlfriend had to admit is one of the best systems in Europe. We got a 3 day pass for the metro which was only €11 each. There is a line A and line B which take you to every part of the city you need to go to. It is also set back from the station just enough so that you aren't disturbed by any noise in the evenings. When doing the sight seeing things it's definitely worthing latching onto a tour as for a few extra quid you get info about the place you're seeing and more importantly skip the massive queue's that are at each major attraction. Be weary of the gypsie's at the main metro stations, they eye up everyone's bag's and rucksacks as they wait on the platforms then as you're about to board they work as a team, using the mum's with babies as a decoy to raid the bags. This didn't happen to us but we saw it happen. All in all though it was an excellent trip and we are planning to go back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: bb8787
Reviews.Content: This charming hotel was convenient, comfortable, and clean. Our room was surprisingly large with a balcony and sofa. The decor is modern, and comes right out of an Ikea showroom. The staff was helpful and very friendly! We were surprised to learn that breakfast was included, and we weren't disappointed. The location is very convenient to the Termini/metro/taxi station, and only a few stops by metro to the Spanish Steps, or Vatican. It's also convenient for walking to the Colosseum and other major sites. There are a couple of charming cafes, with great food, that are within 3 blocks of the hotel. We would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience and comfort”
Reviews.Author: DrNo7
Reviews.Content: Of the 5 hotels we stayed during this trip, this provides the best overall experience - service, design, comfort. Best of all, the hotel offers free wireless internet.

Reviews.Title: “Average rooms, ours was quite small...”
Reviews.Author: sburtoffski
Reviews.Content: Average rooms, ours was quite small, furnished in ikea-esk decor and had flashing lights in the room (fire detector) all night. Was clean and modern though

Reviews.Title: “Small, but modern rooms near Termini Station”
Reviews.Author: NYCTraveller999
Reviews.Content: Overview: You might be able to get more for your money in terms of space, but the modern amenities and very comfortable beds make up for it. If you want a hotel near the train station, this one's definitely a good option. Location: Just a couple of short blocks away from Termini Station. No cab needed. 15-20 minute walk to main points of interest: Colosseum, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps. Short and cheap metro ride to farther spots like Vatican City. Not a ton of restaurants very close to the hotel, but definitely a couple of decent ones and there a bunch more when you walk towards Via Cavour. Rooms: We booked a standard double and it was definitely very small. A bed, dresser area/ w flat screen TV, a closet and a tiny bit of walking room. Bathroom was very small (shower only), but very modern and a smart use of space. Beds were VERY comfortable, and the rooms have wifi, which was convenient. Breakfast: Included with our rate. The usual stuff, all pretty good, but no huge buffet. Some yogurt, cereal, meats, cheeses, croissants and other pastries Service: Friendly, pretty quick and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel in the Eternal City”
Reviews.Author: bm_see_all_7
Reviews.Content: Round two in Europe… After a week in Paris now a week in Rome. 4 star hotels are a must, they might be a few dollars more but well worth it! After looking long and hard for a well priced hotel I found the Venetia Palace at a great price! They were having a deal on their rooms when I went to book our trip, but even without, their prices are very competitive for similar hotels! I only have one negative thing to say about the hotel then I will move on… it is not really near the ‘center’ of Rome. But that was our choice, so it’s really not a negative! Hope on a bus, the metro, or put your walking shoes on your going to no matter where you stay in Rome!!! The hotel is two blocks away from Termini Station, so you are a few steps from the train, metro and the busses. The biggest bonus of this hotel…IT IS NEW!!! Very modern in its architecture! Very clean! Great front desk staff, Great bartender at night! The hotel has a nice little bar/lounge that is open in the evenings, a great way to unwind and relax! Complimentary breakfast was the same every day, but no complaints here, the point is to get a quick ‘pick me up’ for another day of adventure through the streets of Rome. Luggage hold in the lobby a plus. Elevator a plus. Free WiFi a plus. The rooms are small, but who cares, you don’t spend time in Rome to be in your room. Mini fridge in the room, we moved the stock stuff out and put our drinks in, and they didn’t seem to mind! A few cafes and restaurants right out your door, you can’t go wrong, but where can you go wrong in Eternal City? Plus the hotel has a small fitness room and a Jacuzzi on the roof! This hotel was GREAT!

Reviews.Title: “4 stars hotel-2 stars value”
Reviews.Author: anlicry
Reviews.Content: I just came back from Rome during Christmas holiday when we stayed in Rome for 4 nights. Basically, my partner and me are frequently travellers in quite many different countries who have at least a minimal tasty of choosing hotels. Althought we didn't book the 5 star hotel but both of us believe 4 stars hotel should be sufficient enough to have a fair holiday in Italy. We spent 2 nights staying ina splendid hotel in Venice prior to we go to Rome by taking air plane. Truly, splendid hotel left us quite a good impression. As we took the evening flight to Rome, it had been a little bit of late when the time we arrived to our hotel. The location of hotel is definitely close to terminal station, however, we didn't expect this hotel is a little bit of far from the main street. There had been some drunkers on the street when we tried to find out where is our "4 star hotel." We tried to ask other people who are working in other three star hotels on the same street of our hotel. Eventually, we found out that our hotel is behind many 2 or 3 star hotels after we went through the street which looks quite doggy at night. When arriving, there was no door-conciage coming out to help us carry any of our luggage (Fortunatelly, I can manage to carry our two small-size suite cases to go up stairs as you can see in the their pictures). I have to say that at least there were doormen in the Splendid hotel. I was a little bit of surprise that the staff in the night shift didn't wear any uniform of their hotel. The other guy did wear but he couldn't even speak English. We still gave the unhelpful non-english speaking guy the tips as we treat other hotel staffs as same. Then, we were given a standerd room (which means the smallest room in the hotel). There was a tricky thing that we paid two people but we only get a SINGLE double bed room. When we firstly came inside the room, both of us were stunned by the size of room and their model design of room layout. The shower and toilet are behind of the bed and even the textile of shower tub looks quite dirty because they use the un-revamped stone as a kind of rennovated design. As my partner is sensitive of the air in the room, we tried to open the heater up, so the room air can recycle again. However, the control panal of central air condition seems not work properly. There were no any air coming out from the fan exit. We thought that their central air condition system must be broken up. Both of us were quite upset because we had arriaved lately and only wanted to go to bed after taking a warm shower. We eventually went down to ask the inconsistant staff to change the other room for us because we really felt suffocation in a non-air room. He gave us the other room in which the shower and toilet are set in the normal way. Despite we had tested whether the air condition (heater) works properly, we ultimately gave up and open the window to let fresh air come into our room. As other reviewer said, the interior of hotel actually looks quite IKEA-Y, you can tell the material of decoration is quite cheapy, you can tell that the wood-like furnitures are really surpirse you that they can be rated as a 4 stars hotel. The most rudeness thing is that there were one woman treating us as the second class customer when we went down to eat our breakfast at second morning. We console ourselves that theiir staffs were on holiday during Christmas so they changed their staffs every day, even the people working in the kitchen. The woman seemed not want to serve us coffee after my partner asked her to do so because my partner saw her asked other customers coming down later than us. I didn't notice because normally I don' any habit to drink coffee in the morning. However, that woman even didn't say any sorry to us after we found out her own misbehaviour. My partner was quite upset after we joined the tourist bus to going around the city because we saw many same 4 stars hotels are located in a good area and outstanding lounge and beautiful design which is much better than our IKea-y hotel. The other ridiculous thing is the last morning prior to we leave this hotel. The clearner maidress went into our room to clean when we set up the "Don't disturb light outiside the door" We really felt quite unsecurity when we forgot to leave our some valuable things on the table. It really makes us feel quite nervous. They absolutely were merely 2 stars hotel or less because after we checked out to leave our two luggages to their reception and the front desk guy even didn't give us any ticket to reserve our lugguage in their luggage room which means any one could take away our luggages or put any unsafe items inside our suitecases. Even don't want to mention that we won't want to come back to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: Ctheo
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Rome airport early and took the train to Rome City. This hotel was 3 blocks from the train station. The hotel rooms were new and the front desk was eager to help make my stay pleasent. There were lots of places to eat that were very good for a small price (and that is hard to find for Rome). The Hop on Hop Off type buses leave from the front of the train station and that made it easy to see all the sights and not get lost in the city. At the end of my stay in the City of Rome we took the train to the cruise ship ($12 for 2 people) The train station area has it all. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was all we hoped for!”
Reviews.Author: PegNorthCarolina
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Venetia Palace only one night before taking a cruise and were very happy with our choice made after much research online. Since we had only 2 half days in Rome before cruise, the location was excellent -- just 3 minute walk to Termini. We felt the cost was reasonable, and the continental breakfast was excellent -- much better than we expected. Staff was very helpful with directions. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, but not recommended for typical Italian/Roman experience”
Reviews.Author: julescub
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great on approach, and perfectly located right behind the Termini Station in Rome...IF YOU ARRIVE BY DAY!!! (Be aware that we walked around the wrong side of the Termini one evening, after returning from dinner, and got extremely lost in a very unsavoury area. We eventually managed to get a taxi back to the hotel, but I was extremely grateful to be with my boyfriend, who could've have taken care of any situation that may have occurred). On arrival, the hotel is designed well, to give the appearance of an arty style environment, but is fundamentally quite 'Ikea-y'. The rooms are very small and have the bathroom contained in them, similar to a room in student halls. Admittidly, the rooms are very clean and well designed. The showers are nice, but make sure you're with someone that you feel very comfortable with - you can see the bathroom through the screens in the bedroom and hear everything! The hotel offers a roof spa, but it was closed with no explanation as to why, even though the weather was very pleasant. You can use the sauna and steam room, but the steam room did not smell very clean, and you need to book your time slots. It's a nice way to unwind after a long day around Rome though. The breakfasts are good, but very limited healthy choices. There's plenty of nice cakes and pastries though. Overall, the service is over cool. The lady on the desk in the evening is extremely rude and not very willing to help! There is no iron - so you will have to pay for any clothes to be ironed 24 hours prior to needing them. They also have very little information on anything in the local area. For example, we asked for a nice restaurant for dinner on our last night and were advised to go right across the other side of Rome. When I asked if there was anywhere nearer (which I knew there would be, as I've been to Rome several times), I was advised that the area we were going to is particularly good for dining and the restaurant recommended wouldn't disappoint. After eventually finding the restaurant - again in quite a 'choicy' street - it had MTV playing on a big screen and was not an authentic Italian restaurant at all! In addition, when we eventually returned home from dinner we were locked out of the hotel!!! The door bell was apparently not working for the receptionist to open the doors. Not ideal! Overall, the hotel is great for arriving by bus from the airport, and convenient for any early morning starts, and is very modern....but there are many other more central locations that would probably offer better service, and have more to offer in the area, including in the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “5* hotel for 3* value”
Reviews.Author: gemma_and_lee
Reviews.Content: Very modern hotel in a classic old Roman building. Very clean and well kept. Minimalistic but comfortable and relaxing rooms. Bathroom was spacious but be prepared that the floor may get very wet because the shower door is very slim (same comment as many others!). Really not a show stopper though. Hot tub with a cold beer is a fantastic touch and can't imagine would be available in many other places in Rome! Pleasant walk to the attractions, not on the doorstep but not a marathon either. Well maintained area around the hotel and very convenient for the airport. By far the best presented hotel in the area. We had a fabulous stay.

Reviews.Title: “"Simply the Best"”
Reviews.Author: Mikebisatraveler
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a Hotel in Rome that is a 5 Star Hotel at a great price, an awesome Staff and a location where you can walk two minutes to the Train Station than the Venetia is the place for you! How many times can you have a Hot Tub, Work out Room, Steam Room, Sauna, Bar and a Breakfast Cafe all in one Hotel at no extra charge? Not many than I can think of. I was on a Trip to see the Pope, tour the City, see the Coliseum and St.Paul's Cathedral as well as the Vatican. With help from Mihaela I was given Directions and the best way to get to each one of these places in 3 Days. I had some Knee Surgery two months prior to my trip so I needed to take a Bus Tour to most of them. If the knee was fine I could have done all of these by Train. The Room I had was the perfect size. Free Wi- Internet Service and a great TV with options to watch up to 20 Channels or use Pay Per View. I will be back in Rome one day and I will stay at a great "Palace", the Venetia Palace!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great modern hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Mullet94
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed here for a week and enjoyed the stay immensely. The hotel is only 3 blocks from Roma Termini Station so is very convenient for getting around Rome. The rooms are very modern and are well kept and the jacuzzi bath is great for reviving those aching legs after a day spent walking around the sights of Rome, also the staff are very friendly and helpful. A very nice stay in a very good location for discovering Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: EastBayGrease
Reviews.Content: Clean and modern styled rooms, the Venetia Palace was a great place to stay. Within walking distance to the Termini and Ristorante Donati we enjoyed our 4 night stay. The staff was very helpful and the breakfast was excellent. Wasn’t particularly enthralled with staff’s restaurant recommendations nor the half-glass shower door (a least the towels are adsorbent), overall we enjoyed our stay and recommend the Venetia Palace/.

Reviews.Title: “NICE MODERN HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: CORINAIreland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in September, the hotel is very modern and very close to the train station which is handy. Didnt feel unsafe in this area at all and we were walking back late every night. Hotel is around a 20 mins walk to the coliseum and all the other sights are within walking distance if your prepared to walk. We bought the hop on/hop off bus ticket but it seemed a waste as the traffic was so bad it was quicker to walk to the sights. As regards the hotel the bed was very comfortable, breakfast was good, staff in the breakfast room were lovely. The only thing that put me off this hotel was the frosted door in the bathroom which you could see through.

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sleekjaney
Reviews.Content: Generally impressed with hotel & even though it isn't that far from the main train station it's far enough away that it's not too dangerous although to be honest I didn't feel overly safe anywhere in Rome. The Breakfast wasn't overly impressive but then it was certainly not the worst I had ever had like one traveller has said, it's probably not 4* standard but then again it was ok. Room was an ok size and nice & modern. I wasn't too keen on the frosted glass door to the bathroom though as you could see through it a little. Hotel staff seemed friendly & spoke English reasonably well so no probs there. There are a few restaurants nearby but the choice of food served there is ok but reasonably basic. It's a shame I can't remember the name of one of the restaurants as would urge anyone to avoid as they served me a plate of road kill one evening (at least that's what it looked like just minus the tyre marks). Think it was called Lupo or something. As mentioned earlier it's not far from the train station so very easy to get around on the metro etc. Be very careful everywhere you go though as there are plenty of thieves about. The sites in Rome are very impressive but I was a little disappointed as the area seems to have gone down hill since my last visit 4 years ago & there is certainly a lot more graffiti everywhere. Would recommend this hotel though especially if you get it for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “WET CARPET!!! Yuck!!”
Reviews.Author: Natvtxn09
Reviews.Content: I arrived in Rome on my last night in Italy only to find out that the hotel room I used points to book was not available. The desk clerk at the Morgana Royal Court stated they had a "problem" with another guest and did not have a room for me but don’t worry we booked you in another hotel right around the corner. I was leery but she said it was a "four star" hotel (The Venetia Palace). After trudging to the new hotel, in the rain, I was forced to wait in the lobby for over an hour while they prepared my room. I was unable to book a tour for my last night in Rome because of this delay. Finally I was able to enter my room, which I thought smelled musty, but since it was already so late I just left my things in the room before leaving, trying to salvage something of my evening. When I returned later that night, after dinner, I discovered that the carpet in the entire room was WET, not damp but soaking wet. At this point I was so tired, and it was so late that I did not want to go through the hassle of changing rooms since I was leaving very early in the morning to catch my plane. I discovered the next morning that the shower did not drain properly and was most likely the reason for the wet floor. Upon check out I told the desk clerk that the floor was wet and the shower did not drain, all he said was Si Si, we know. What kind of hotel knowingly puts guests in rooms with wet carpet?? I did not originally choose to stay at this hotel and I can assure you that I will NEVER stay there again on any future trips to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Well located, comfortable hotel, fantastic staff - I will return!”
Reviews.Author: Craigycraig
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 7 nights with my partner, at the end of August / beginning of September, and I would love to return. Location The location was great for us, being as it is, a very short walk from the main train station, which made travel to / from the airport easy (direct train from the Airport to Station). The station has an underground shopping mall, with a good sized super market, ideal for picking up Peroni at sensible prices! In addition, the station's underground / tube station is ideal if you'd rather not walk everywhere, and you can easy get a tube to sights such as Coliseum, Spanish Steps, Vatican etc. A friend who had lived in Rome for 4 years, had mentioned to me, that the area around the station was not the most desirable, however we were coming & going at all times of day & night, and didn't feel threatened / scared at all. Indeed, the area around the hotel seemed much nicer than the areas around the other side of the station, and I'm hard pressed to think of many cities where the areas around stations are glamorous. Staff The reception staff are amazing, especially Marco and Mihaela, who were very efficient, friendly, and helpful. On a direct flight from Gatwick, BA managed to lose both our bags, and Marco and Mihaela helped us lots, especially when trying to get in contact with BA's representatives in Italy. Over the years, I've stayed in many hotels, and both Marco and Mihaela must be among the most friendly and helpful I've ever encountered, and are a credit to the hotel. The breakfast waiter was great too, as my partner has a preference for espresso's, which the waiter went out his way to make fresh for him each morning. Room The rooms do seem to be a bit on the small side, and are somewhat minimalistic. That said, it was by no means the smallest hotel room I've ever slept in, and I guess you're not going to visit Rome and then spend all day in your room. We were lucky enough to be on the 5th floor, and we had a balcony, which was great, as it was a fab place to sit out in and relax after being out all day, and a great place to sit first thing in the morning (before it got too hot). The bathroom was a bit strange, with almost see through glass doors in the bathroom (doesn't leave much to the imagination), and whilst the bathroom was very smart / clean / trendy, it's probable not the most practical. The air con was invaluable, as it was soooooo hot when we visited, and I'm not a great fan of the sun / heat, and it worked a treat, cooling the room to a more comfortable level. The hotel had a small gym too, which seemed well enough equipped for a hotel gym, although I never did try it out, and it also was great to find a hot tub on the roof, which was such a bonus, and a great way to unwind after a hard days walking. Breakfast Food / breakfast can often be a contentious area. You will be disappointed if you're used to / are expecting a large breakfast area with chiefs a plenty standing around cooking your eggs to perfection, however I found the breakfast to be more than adequate, and on a couple of days enjoyed breakfast outside on the small patio area. The breakfast was self service, and consisted of a good selection of cold meats, scrambled eggs, cheese, and numerous cakes / pastries, as well as cereals, fresh fruit and yoghurt - you can't really ask for more, and the breakfast pretty much kept us going all day, especially with all the walking / sightseeing we did. Overall The hotel / bar / rooms are indeed small / minimalistic, especially when compared to other western hotels, however the great central location, the fantastic staff, the lovely room with balcony, and of course, the hot tub on the roof, make this place a little gem, a superb place to stay, and a hotel that I'd love to visit again, and I hope I do soon!

Reviews.Title: “awful breakfast ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveltortoise
Reviews.Content: probably the worst breakfast I have ever had in a hotel anywhere in the world. Friendly staff, nice shower in a very small/modern bathroom.nice quiet room

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: L0nd0nGenie
Reviews.Content: From FCO its about 30mins to get to Termini (direct). Hotel located 2 minutes walk from Termini Station (exit via Marsala, cross road and and walk straight ahead), so very convenient to get anywhere in Rome for 1 euro each way on the trains. Staff are friendly and helpful and give u a map and mark out areas of interest. Safety-wise it seemed fine as its becoming very popular with tourists. If you are exhausted and dont walk to head back into central busy Rome, we dined out in the area in the evening (turn right out of the hotel and first left, down the road on the corner) and the food and service was really good. Also cheaper than the general tourist places. Breakfast was mostly continental. Hotel carpet could do with some cleaning. Quite minimalistic look, concrete floor in shower. Air conditioned which was just heaven after being out in the heat walking around the whole day. Would recommend area and hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique, but manage your expectations...”
Reviews.Author: monkeyface09
Reviews.Content: Great location as it was super close to the train station (main transportation hub/express train to airport/Conad supermarket) and walking distance to key sites without being amid the overly touristy centre. Other positives include accommodating staff, clean rooms, decent full breakfast, and no issues coming back late. Despite many good points, the hotel did not live up to its four-star, "boutique" status. Besides major leakage in the ceiling, bathroom design needs rethinking as the placement of the showerhead resulted in wet carpeting and there were not enough places to hang towels. Another design issue is the lack of places by the sink to put the soap, which left the counter wet and slimy. Finally, do NOT use the long distance service advertised on phone in the room if you wish to avoid any surprises on your credit card bill. In the future, the hotel should provide information on rates.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Room in Ancient City”
Reviews.Author: 2together42
Reviews.Content: Bright modern room with comfortable large bed. Helpful staff especially when Delta lost our bag. Good size room for Europe. Bathroom wonderful. Great shower! Hot tub on roof nice and relaxing at end of the day. Short walk to train station. Our room (not facing street) was surprising quiet. Free wi-fi. Full breakfast very filling but not too exciting.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: citybreak007
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in July. The location is perfect for exploring Rome; it is a 2min walk to Termini. The hotel is in a nice quiet street and we would definately stay here again. The hotel is VERY modern, thus the rooms are quite small BUT the roof terrace and hot tub are a nice touch and the staff are very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Venetia Palace Hotel - PERFECTO!!!”
Reviews.Author: Steeler94
Reviews.Content: I travel all over the world on business and pleasure and greatly enjoyed my stay at the Venetia Palace Hotel in Roma. Very friendly staff, very helpful and great english... Very stylish rooms, clean and comfortable. Wifi Access, super bathrooms. They even have a Sauna and Hot Tub. This is near our Rome office and I will be booking this hotel when I am in Roma in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: fcmg62
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for three nights and the experience was fantastic. The rooms were clean and stylishly designed and the staff were friendly and helpful, more so than any other Italian hotel I've stayed in. The small roof terrace and spa were an added extra that I got full use out of and the location close to Termini station meant that returning to the hotel late at night via bus, metro or taxi was really easy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LLEWIE
Reviews.Content: Visited Rome for 4 nights for my 50th birthday. Hotel in excellent position close to Termini Station (about a five minute walk). The tour buses also start/stop outside Termini but we walked everywhere as very easy to get around for all the popular sights, 20 - 30 min walk to Colosseum. We did get the metro for the Vatican and train out to Nettuno (seaside town) about an hour away when the weather was very hot one day. Breakfast is adequate and the rooftop Jacuzzi is great for a late afternoon relax after sightseeing! restaurants in the area are fine; for someting a little different try Africa restaurant a couple of blocks from the hotel. The food is amazing and great if you want something other than the usual Italian cuisine. I would recommend this hotel to others and would go back again if staying in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel great for exploring rome”
Reviews.Author: holzo
Reviews.Content: this is a gem of a hotel located five minutes walk from termini station.from the moment you arrive the staff are very friendly and welcoming especially marco at reception.we arrived early and our rooms were ready.the rooms are very modern.great air con. lots of towels changed each day.flat screen tv wi fi lots of wardrobe space mini bar.great rooftop jacuzzi which we used each day.great breakfast room with large spread of breads pastries juice coffees eggs bacon you could not go hungry.termini station is ideal for exploring rome by metro and tour bus .hop on/off buses are the best way to see sights.would come back with no hesitation and have already recommended it to friends

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located new hotel”
Reviews.Author: Odiechau
Reviews.Content: We are used to pricey hotels in Rome; with this one I believe is a little better value than the other ones around Termini area. 1st it's v. new and trendy on the nicer side of Termini area 5 minutes from Rail Station; subway; buses Front desk helpful when I requested champagne glasses and ice late @ night. There's complimentary jacuzzi on roof top (v. nice and relaxing) Free internet The only thing I have to complain about is the modern fixtures in bathroom are not v. user friendly...it took us a couple of minutes to find the drain release and I keep bumping and bruising myself on the square faucet knobs

Reviews.Title: “Smart and funky design-led hotel close to Termini Station”
Reviews.Author: ZippyLondon
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Thomas Cook so actually doubted it would actually be there on our arrival - but that's another story though it's safe to say we'd never use Thomas Cook again...even if they were the last agent in the world! I digress... We were really pleased to find that the hotel was, at max, a five or six minute walk from the zoo that is Termini Station. It's fair to say that the area is not the best in Rome although it will suit you perfectly if you are coming/leaving from Termini. Restaurant choices are limited but, that said, you won't starve either. Being close to the station allows for easy pick-up of tourist buses - but caution - be prepared to stand in line, with no shade, for 30+ minutes waiting for a bus with space - this is despite assurances, when you are sold the tickets, that there is a very short wait. Seamless check-in from a serious, but pleasant enough chap, room 302. The room was spotlessly clean with minimalist furniture and fittings - good level of comfort and decent TV and free Wi-Fi. Nice Jacuzzi bath if you like that sort of thing. Jacuzzi on 6th floor - nice touch although quite cozy if more than a couple of users at any one time - definately worth a try. Breakfast - Nice selection of pastries, breads for toasting (in possibly the worlds slowest toaster), good enough coffee from one of those automatic machines, OJ not quite so nice. A perfectly acceptable breakfast. In conclusion, we'd have no hesitation in staying at this hotel again but the staff could just be a little bit more friendlier - and would have got the full 5 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, though a bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: southerngirlndc
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a 10 minute walk from Rome Termini, the main train station in Rome. The hotel also has tour buses that pick up from the hotel. From the hotel, I was able to walk all around Rome, including to the Colosseo and the Roman Forum. The rooms are decorated with a trendy flair -all white. The rooms are a comfortable size, with a clean modern bathroom and a balcony (very nice touch). The hotel has a jacuzzi and a Turkish sauna, which was nice. The hotel also has breakfast, which was decent -bacon, eggs, pastries, and fruit juice. The staff was incredibly, incredibly helpful, professional and friendly and helped me enjoy my stay. The hotel is pretty pricey (150 euros per night for my room). The location is called a little dangerous, but I did not find it so and I walked, alone, in the area at night. It is well populated. The area reminds me of the area around Penn Station in NY or Union Station in DC. On the whole, I would recommend this hotel and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and modern”
Reviews.Author: Mopa1009
Reviews.Content: The Venetia Palace Hotel is a very good choice if you prefer modern hotels. Everything is new and and clean, the service is impeccable, the breakfast quite good compared to other hotels in Rome and the location is great, if you don't mind a short walk in order to get to the main sights of the city.

Reviews.Title: “best 4 star hotel near termini”
Reviews.Author: claudio28
Reviews.Content: we stayed in the hotel between 23/03/09 and 27/03/09. the hotel was gorgeous! the breakfast was very good ( most hotels in rome have awful breacfast).the room was big in compare with other roman hotels, the staff was very kind( believe me they were VERY kind) and the location in my opinion, is the best because termini is the heart of public transport in rome!! next time definitely i ll stay in venetia palace!!! ( dont forget to take the open turist buses, its great fun and you can see all the monuments very easy!!)

Reviews.Title: “The Venetia Palace from a Single (Solo) American Traveler's Point of View”
Reviews.Author: JzeroT1937
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Venetia Palace Hotel from March 20th-25th despite having been warned against this part of town. There are certainly more upscale, gentrified areas of town, but this one is safe enough and conveniently located near the main terminal, from where you can go anywhere in Rome or Italy. I wouldn’t have stayed anywhere else (but I’m also a 6’8” male who was running the Rome Marathon, so I’m less likely to feel threatened, I suppose). As for the hotel itself, the Venetia Palace is superb. I arrived hours early and was helped by the delightful Mihaela, a Romanian woman with an impeccable grasp of the English language (during my stay I found all of the staff to be fluent in English). Despite being early, my room had already been prepared and I was allowed in—I was staying in a double room meant for single use, and was honestly surprised at the amenities and room. First, the bedroom; at $105 a night (off Expedia) I got the equivalency of a queen sized bed (two doubles pushed together), a decent-sized flat screen TV (20 or 27”—I’m not really sure), desk, stationary, a closet cabinet, safe, phone, free wi-fi, minibar, and a room spacious enough for me (but others may need more room. I live in a very tiny apartment, so I'm used to staying in a single room with a bathroom--it was like being home). The room was kept very clean and had turnover service each day. In order to power any and every thing in the room, it was necessary to leave your key card in a little slot by the door—an interesting detail I also found at the Albergotto, my hotel in Florence. I wish I’d taken a photo of the room now, but I was more interested in the bathroom at the time—I guess because it was my first time out of the country and Eurobathrooms are pretty different. The bathroom had a full toilet (seat too! Thank god!), toilet paper, bidet, bathtub/Jacuzzi/shower combo, towel radiator (a common amenity I found in all of my hotels and which came in quite handy during my final day in Venice), and large sink with a plethora of different-sized towels underneath it. Simply put, it was an impressive room. Having never used a European shower before, I burned and froze myself a few times before figuring out the top knob turned the water on while the bottom one adjusted the heat of it. The shower head in the Venetia Palace hotel was stationary and sprayed jets of water down which could sometimes be painful—usually only if you tried to wash your face. Imagine having big angry bolts of water being thrust at your eyeballs and you’ll see what I mean. The breakfast the hotel offered was amazing. It had eggs, bacon, several kinds of bread, delicious croissant-pastries, three kinds of cereal, fruits, coffee, tea, orange juice, yogurt, and water. I couldn’t ask for more—especially considering how awful American hotel breakfasts usually are. The hotel also had a Turkish bath/sauna, gym (which I used every morning), and meeting rooms. Although the gym is not all-encompassing, I found the precor unit very useful in keeping with my daily fitness, and really appreciated its existence. My routine in Rome was this: wake up around 10 or 11, go see some ruins/museums, eat around 6 or 7, take a nap until about 10:30, then go down to Campo dei Fiori, the American bar hotspot, and party until 2 in the morning. The staff of the Venetia Palace lock the door to the hotel sometime after midnight, but there was always somebody waiting at reception to let me in, no matter how late I arrived back (and believe me—I came back LATE some nights! One time at 3:45!). After a few days I fell in love with Rome and decided to cancel my 2-day plans for Naples/Capri for 2 more days in Rome, and the hotel was happy to extend my stay with no problems. They stored my luggage until I left for Florence at six on my final day in Rome, and were very warm and welcoming during my entire stay. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anybody looking for a place to stay in Rome—it’s a definite gem in the Termini section of town, and is pretty cheap by Euro-hotel standards!

Reviews.Title: “brilliant hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: devonian81
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 4 nights - room was brillant! location - 5 mins walk from the main termini/metro and 20mins to the coleseum. breakfast - everything you could want - bread, cheese, ham, ceral , fruit, eggs, coffee, juice, yoghurt.

HotelInfo.Name: Venetia Palace Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Marghera 47/A, 185 Rome, Italy
